results.title: Heredity
results.brief_description: The Mendelian theory of heredity and the Mendelian laws are presented by means of animated diagrams, and by showing animals which demonstrate the Mendelian theory.

results.title: Heredity
results.creator_credit: Country Education Project, Glen Foster and David Zweck
results.brief_description: Peter Couchman chairs a discussion between Professor David Danks from the Royal Children’s Hospital and Professor Roger Short from Monash University on issues surrounding genetics. Computerised simulation of matings between domestic animals are used to illustrate the discussion.

results.title: Here to there
results.creator_credit: Herschells Films and Roy A. Driver
results.brief_description: Shows some aspects of Australian road transport and demonstrates the indispensable role of motor transport in the swift transit of goods, ranging from the smallest parcels, to wool and heavy machinery. Concludes with the moving of a giant 32-ton gas generator 90 miles by road.
results.description: Shows some aspects of Australian road transport and demonstrates the indispensable role of motor transport in the swift transit of goods, ranging from the smallest parcels, to wool and heavy machinery. Concludes with the moving of a giant 32-ton gas generator 90 miles by road.

results.title: Here it is, burlesque!
results.creator_credit: Home Box Office, Michael Brandman and Marty Callner
results.brief_description: This stage production presents burlesque performance in all its colourful forms. Exotic dancing, classic wide-tied comedians, striptease and chorus girls. There is no holding back on costumes with feathers, sequins and skimpy outfits for the ladies, not forgetting the all American male stripper to balance things. This revealing stage show presents burlesque in the lively and racy way that it was originally intended. Performers include Ann Corio, Morey Amsterdam and Pinky Lee.

results.title: Here is the Gold Coast
results.brief_description: In west Africa strenuous efforts are being made to improve the land and make it more productive in every way. Three million pounds will be spent by the British government in the Gold Coast area in the next ten years in an attempt to bring irrigation, scientific farming, hygiene and education to the colony.

results.title: Here is Canada
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Colin Low and Tony Ianzelo
results.brief_description: Viewers outside Canada, and Canadians themselves, here have the pleasure of looking at, understanding, and discovering the many facets of this vast land, presented in choice film footage that is at once informative, visually appealing, and absorbing.

results.title: Here is a plan; The House on any street; And this for the country children
results.creator_credit: Spastic Centre, Mosman, Avondale and Roland Litchfield
results.brief_description:
Three short documentary films relating to the establishment of two centres in Sydney designed to improve the quality of life for children with cerebral palsy.
Contents: Here is a plan (b&w, 6:10 mins, 222’)—The House on any street (col., 5:37 mins, 202’)—And this for the country children (col., 4:08 mins, 149’)

results.title: Here comes the sun
results.creator_credit: Image Associates, Bastian Wimmer and Clayton J. Edwards
results.brief_description: Four solar energy experiments have been set up by the National Science Foundation in four different school buildings in four different parts of the United States. The systems are located in Virginia, Maryland, Massachussetts and Minnesota, each utilising a basic system, but with slight differences in each unit.

results.title: Here comes the cat
results.brief_description: This is a short animated film based on the Russian children’s book written and illustrated by Frank Asch and Vladimir Vagin. The mice are all going about their business on a beautiful day when a menacing feline shadow begins to creep over the hills toward the village. A pink-shirted mouse takes to the skies in a hot air balloon, heralding the arrival of this threat to public safety by shouting, “Here comes the cat!”. Chaos follows this announcement and the village descends into a mad panic as the ginger kitty creeps closer and closer. But when the cat finally arrives, it becomes suddenly apparent that all is not as it seems.

results.title: Here comes Mr. Jordan
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Everett Riskin and Alexander Hall
results.brief_description: Joe Pendleton (Robert Montgomery), is a contender for the light heavyweight boxing crown, but is killed in a plane crash. An angel (Edward Everett Horton), realising the error that Joe has arrived in heaven 50 years too early. Trying to rectify the mistake, Mr. Jordon (Claude Rains), the chief deispatcher of the “Heavenly Express” sends Joe back to earth in the body of a just-murdered millionaire. This delightful romantic comedy was so successful, it inspired a musical sequel, “Down to Earth” and was remade as “Heaven can wait” in 1978.
